Package com.accele.gage.tile

Class TileMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.tile.TileMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Indexable, Renderable, Tickable
    public class TileMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Indexable, Tickable, Renderable, Cleanable
    A collection of Tile instances that are rendered seamlessly as one large tiled rectangle. GAGE comes with a built-in external tile map reader to easily parse large or complicated tile maps. Refer to TILE_MAP_LOADER for more details.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland
    See Also:
    TILE_MAP_LOADER

      Constructs a TileMap with the specified registry ID and TileMapMeta.

      void clean()
      Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height, in tiles, of the TileMap.

      Returns the registry ID to use in the Registry.
      Tile[] getTiles()
      Returns the tiles used in the TileMap.
      int getVisibleTilesX()
      Returns the number of tiles visible on the screen at any one time in the x-direction for this TileMap.
      int getVisibleTilesY()
      Returns the number of tiles visible on the screen at any one time in the y-direction for this TileMap.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width, in tiles, of the TileMap.

      Called as many times as possible per second to render the object.

        Constructs a TileMap with the specified registry ID and TileMapMeta.
        Parameters:
        registryId - the registry ID to use in the tile map Registry

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Tickable
        Called a predetermined number of times per second to update the object. This method is designed to update game logic only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object rendering. getTicksPerSecond() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Tickable
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • render

        public void render​(Graphics g,
                   double interpolation)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Called as many times as possible per second to render the object. This method is designed to update object graphics only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object logic. getFps() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        g - the instance of Graphics used by the engine to render objects
        interpolation - the normalized difference in time between when the previous frame was called and when this frame was called
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks. For most engine-specific resources, this method should not be called manually as it is usually always called after stop() has been called.
        Specified by:
        clean in interface Cleanable
